member.name: IFileViewerA.PrintTo
member.summary: Prints a file. The Shell specifies the name of the file to print by calling the file viewer's method.
member.param: A pointer to a buffer that contains the name of the printer device driver that should print the file. If this parameter is NULL, the file viewer determines which device driver to use.

A user interface suppression flag. If this parameter is TRUE, the file viewer should not display any user interface, including error messages, during the print operation. If this parameter is FALSE, the file viewer can show dialog boxes, as needed.

member.name: IFileViewerA.Show
member.summary: Displays a file. The Shell specifies the name of the file to display by calling the file viewer's method.
member.param: A pointer to an structure to contain information that the file viewer uses to display the file. A file viewer can return information to the Shell by modifying the members of the structure.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful, or E_UNEXPECTED if the method was not called before IFileViewerA.Show.

member.name: IFileViewerA.ShowInitialize
member.summary: Allows a file viewer to determine whether it can display a file and, if it can, to perform initialization operations before showing the file.
member.param: A pointer to an interface. A file viewer uses this interface to retrieve the handle to the current pinned window or to specify a new pinned window.
member.returns: The Shell calls this method before the method. The Shell specifies the name of the file to display by calling the file viewer's method.

member.name: IFileViewerA
member.summary: Exposes methods that designate an interface that allows a registered file viewer to be notified when it must show or print a file.
